```bash
cat <<EOF > oss_sovereignty/sys_05_QEMU_KVM/anvil.build.sh
#!/bin/bash

set -eux

# Source: Assuming QEMU is already cloned locally (e.g., via clone_qemu.sh)
# Adjust the source path if necessary.
QEMU_SRC_DIR=./qemu

# Destination: Installation directory within the Anvil build environment.
INSTALL_DIR=./dist

# Ensure the installation directory exists.
mkdir -p "$INSTALL_DIR"

# Configure, Make, and Install QEMU. Adjust configure options as needed.
# IMPORTANT:  This assumes that the qemu source code is present at the
# relative path ./qemu. If the QEMU source is located elsewhere or if
# QEMU is not present, this build script will FAIL.
# Modify to point to the ACTUAL location of the QEMU source code.
# Check dependencies using apt or busybox and install locally or skip
# dependencies you cannot solve on the target system.
# This example skips all optional dependencies.

pushd "$QEMU_SRC_DIR"

./configure --target-list=x86_64-softmmu --prefix="$INSTALL_DIR" \
    --static --disable-gtk --disable-sdl --disable-vnc --disable-spice \
    --disable-xen --disable-curses --disable-opengl --disable-capstone \
    --disable-system --disable-blobs --disable-docs

make -j$(nproc)
make install

popd

# Optionally, create a package or archive of the installed files.
# This is just an example; adjust packaging as needed.
# tar -czvf qemu.tar.gz -C "$INSTALL_DIR" .

echo "QEMU built and installed to $INSTALL_DIR"
EOF
```

```bash
#!/bin/bash

set -e

# Source:  https://github.com/micropython/micropython

# Configuration
SCRIPT_DIR=$(dirname "$0")
SOURCE_DIR="micropython" # Name of the cloned source dir. Assumes its alongside this script.
BUILD_DIR="./build"
INSTALL_DIR="./dist"
PREFIX="/usr/local" # Installation prefix within the dist folder.

# Clone the MicroPython repository if it doesn't exist.
if [ ! -d "${SOURCE_DIR}" ]; then
  echo ">> Cloning Micropython..."
  git clone https://github.com/micropython/micropython ${SOURCE_DIR}
else
  echo ">> Micropython source already present."
fi

# Build MicroPython for unix (adjust target as needed).
echo ">> Building MicroPython..."
mkdir -p ${BUILD_DIR}
cd ${SOURCE_DIR}

# Initialize submodules
git submodule update --init

# Create a 'build' directory if one does not exist
if [ ! -d "mpy-cross/build" ]; then
  mkdir -p mpy-cross/build
fi

make -j $(nproc) -C mpy-cross

# Build the unix port
make -j $(nproc) -C ports/unix

# Create install directory
mkdir -p "${INSTALL_DIR}${PREFIX}/bin"

# Install the executable
echo ">> Installing Micropython..."
cp ports/unix/micropython "${INSTALL_DIR}${PREFIX}/bin"

echo ">> Build and installation complete.  Artifacts in ${INSTALL_DIR}"
cd ${SCRIPT_DIR}
```

```bash
#!/bin/bash
```

```bash
make -j$(nproc)
```

```bash
make install CONFIG_PREFIX="$INSTALL_DIR"

# Cleanup (optional)

echo ">> BusyBox build complete. Installation directory: $INSTALL_DIR"

cd "$SOURCE_DIR"
EOF
```

```bash
cat <<EOF > oss_sovereignty/os_03_Syslinux/anvil.build.sh
#!/bin/bash

set -e

# Source: https://www.syslinux.org/

# Exit immediately if a command exits with a non-zero status.

# Define variables
PACKAGE_NAME="syslinux"
PACKAGE_VERSION="6.04~git20190206.bf6db5b" # Example version, update as needed
SOURCE_URL="https://www.syslinux.org/files/syslinux-6.04-pre1.tar.gz" # Replace with the actual source URL
# Note:  This URL is not working and should be replaced.
# Alternative location is a mirror.  However, official location preferred.
# SOURCE_URL="https://mirrors.edge.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/boot/syslinux/syslinux-6.04-pre1.tar.gz"
SOURCE_ARCHIVE="syslinux-6.04-pre1.tar.gz"
EXTRACTED_DIR="syslinux-6.04-pre1"
BUILD_DIR="./build"
INSTALL_DIR="./dist"
NUM_JOBS=$(nproc)


# Function to download the source code
download_source() {
  if [ ! -f "$SOURCE_ARCHIVE" ]; then
    echo ">> Downloading source code..."
    wget "$SOURCE_URL" -O "$SOURCE_ARCHIVE"
  else
    echo ">> Source code already downloaded."
  fi
}

# Function to extract the source code
extract_source() {
  if [ ! -d "$EXTRACTED_DIR" ]; then
    echo ">> Extracting source code..."
    tar xzf "$SOURCE_ARCHIVE"
  else
    echo ">> Source code already extracted."
  fi
}

# Function to build the package
build_package() {
  echo ">> Building package..."
  mkdir -p "$BUILD_DIR"
  cd "$EXTRACTED_DIR"

  #Add patches here, if required
  #Example: patch -p1 < ../syslinux.patch

  make -C boot/syslinux all

  cd ..
}


# Function to install the package
install_package() {
  echo ">> Installing package..."
  mkdir -p "$INSTALL_DIR"
  cd "$EXTRACTED_DIR"

  make -C boot/syslinux install INSTALL_PATH="$INSTALL_DIR"

  cd ..
}

# Main script execution
download_source
extract_source
build_package
install_package

echo ">> Syslinux build complete.  Installation files in $INSTALL_DIR"
EOF
```

```bash
cat <<EOF > actions.sh
#!/bin/bash

# Set the target directory
TARGET_DIR="oss_sovereignty/bld_01_GCC"

# Check if the target directory exists
if [ ! -d "\${TARGET_DIR}" ]; then
  echo "Target directory \${TARGET_DIR} does not exist. Creating it."
  mkdir -p "\${TARGET_DIR}"
fi

# Function to extract the GCC download command from anvil.build.sh
extract_gcc_download_command() {
  grep -oP 'wget .*gcc-[0-9.]*\.tar\.gz' anvil.build.sh
}

# Extract the GCC download command
download_command=$(extract_gcc_download_command)

# Check if the download command is empty
if [ -z "\${download_command}" ]; then
  echo "Error: Could not find GCC download command in anvil.build.sh"
  exit 1
fi

# Extract the filename from the download command
filename=$(echo "\${download_command}" | awk -F'/' '{print $NF}')

# Construct the full path to the downloaded file
full_path="\${TARGET_DIR}/\${filename}"

# Check if the source code is already present (checking for the archive)
if [ ! -f "\${full_path}" ]; then
  echo "Source code not found. Downloading GCC..."
  cd "\${TARGET_DIR}" || exit 1
  eval "\${download_command}" # Execute the download command
  cd .. || exit 1 # Return to the original directory
else
  echo "Source code already present in \${TARGET_DIR}. Skipping download."
fi

# Extract the tar command from anvil.build.sh
extract_gcc_tar_command() {
  grep -oP 'tar -.*gcc-[0-9.]*\.tar\.gz' anvil.build.sh
}

# Extract the GCC tar command
tar_command=$(extract_gcc_tar_command)

# Extract the directory name that will result from untarring the archive
extracted_dir=$(echo "$filename" | sed 's/\.tar\.gz//')
extracted_dir="$TARGET_DIR/$extracted_dir"

# Check if the extracted directory already exists.  If not, extract.
if [ ! -d "$extracted_dir" ]; then
  echo "Extracting archive..."
  cd "$TARGET_DIR" || exit 1
  eval "$tar_command"
  cd .. || exit 1
fi


# Check if it's a git repository and disconnect from origin
if [ -d "\${extracted_dir}/.git" ]; then
  echo "Found a git repository. Disconnecting from origin..."
  cd "\${extracted_dir}" || exit 1
  git remote remove origin
  if git remote get-url origin 2>/dev/null; then
    echo "Error: Failed to remove origin remote."
    exit 1
  else
    echo "Successfully disconnected from origin."
  fi
  cd ../.. || exit 1
else
  echo "Not a git repository."
fi

# Report the repository status (check for remote origin)
echo "Repository status for \${extracted_dir}:"
cd "\${extracted_dir}" || exit 1
if git remote get-url origin 2>/dev/null; then
  echo "Remote origin still exists."
else
  echo "No remote origin found."
fi
cd ../.. || exit 1
exit 0
EOF
```

```bash
./actions.sh
```

```python
import re

def extract_kernel_source_info(build_script_path):
    """
    Extracts the Linux kernel source URL and destination directory from anvil.build.sh.
    Assumes a wget or git clone command is used.
    """
    try:
        with open(build_script_path, 'r') as f:
            script_content = f.read()

        # First, try to find a git clone command
        git_match = re.search(r'git clone (.*?) (.*?)[\s\n&]', script_content)
        if git_match:
            url = git_match.group(1).strip()
            dest_dir = git_match.group(2).strip()
            return url, dest_dir

        # If no git clone, look for wget and tar extraction
        wget_match = re.search(r'wget (.*?) -O (.*?\.tar.*?)[\s\n&]', script_content)
        if wget_match:
            url = wget_match.group(1).strip()
            tar_file = wget_match.group(2).strip()
            dest_dir_match = re.search(r'tar -x[zv]f '+re.escape(tar_file)+' -C (.*?)[\s\n&]', script_content)
            if dest_dir_match:
                dest_dir = dest_dir_match.group(1).strip()
                return url, dest_dir
        
        return None, None

    except FileNotFoundError:
        print(f"Error: File not found: {build_script_path}")
        return None, None
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error: An error occurred: {e}")
        return None, None

kernel_url, kernel_dir = extract_kernel_source_info("anvil.build.sh")

print(f"Kernel URL: {kernel_url}")
print(f"Kernel Directory: {kernel_dir}")
```

```python
    if busybox_url:

          subprocess.run(["wget", busybox_url], cwd=busybox_dir, check=True, capture_output=True)

          extracted_dir = f"{busybox_dir}/busybox-{busybox_version}"
          files = os.listdir(extracted_dir)
          for f in files:

          os.rmdir(extracted_dir)
          print("BusyBox downloaded and extracted successfully.")

    except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:

# Verify disconnection
```

```bash
#!/bin/bash
```
```bash
# Script to handle the OpenSSH sovereignty task.

# Constants
TARGET_DIR="oss_sovereignty/sys_06_OpenSSH"
ANVIL_BUILD_SH="anvil.build.sh"

# Function to check if a directory exists and is not empty
is_dir_empty() {
  if [ ! -d "$1" ]; then
    return 0 # Directory doesn't exist, consider it empty
  fi
  if [ "$(ls -A "$1")" ]; then
    return 1 # Directory exists and is not empty
  else
    return 0 # Directory exists and is empty
  fi
}

# 1. Analyze anvil.build.sh to identify the OpenSSH source URL.
echo ">> Analyzing $ANVIL_BUILD_SH for OpenSSH source URL..."
OPENSSH_URL=$(grep -Eo 'git clone [^ ]*openssh[^ ]*' "$ANVIL_BUILD_SH" | awk '{print $3}')
# handle tar.gz
if [[ -z "$OPENSSH_URL" ]]; then
    OPENSSH_URL=$(grep -Eo 'wget [^ ]*openssh.*\.tar\.gz' "$ANVIL_BUILD_SH" | awk '{print $2}')
    OPENSSH_TARBALL=$(basename $OPENSSH_URL)
fi

if [[ -z "$OPENSSH_URL" ]]; then
  echo ">> ERROR: Could not find OpenSSH source URL in $ANVIL_BUILD_SH"
  exit 1
fi

echo ">> OpenSSH Source URL: $OPENSSH_URL"

# 2. Clone or download source code if not present.
if is_dir_empty "$TARGET_DIR"; then
  echo ">> $TARGET_DIR is empty. Cloning/Downloading OpenSSH source..."

  if [[ "$OPENSSH_URL" == *".git"* ]]; then
      # Clone the repository
      git clone "$OPENSSH_URL" "$TARGET_DIR"
  else
      # Download and extract the tarball
      wget "$OPENSSH_URL"
      mkdir -p "$TARGET_DIR"
      tar -xzf "$OPENSSH_TARBALL" -C "$TARGET_DIR" --strip-components=1
      rm "$OPENSSH_TARBALL"
  fi

else
  echo ">> $TARGET_DIR already exists. Skipping cloning/downloading."
fi

# 3. Disconnect the git repository.
cd "$TARGET_DIR" || exit 1

if git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  echo ">> Disconnecting Git repository by removing origin..."
  git remote remove origin
  if git remote get-url origin >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo ">> ERROR: Failed to remove remote 'origin'."
  else
    echo ">> Remote 'origin' removed successfully."
  fi
else
  echo ">> Not a Git repository. Skipping disconnection."
fi

# 4. Report status.
echo ">> Current status of $TARGET_DIR:"
ls -la

git remote -v 2>&1 | grep -q "origin"
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  echo ">> ERROR: Remote 'origin' still exists."
else
  echo ">> Remote 'origin' does NOT exist."
fi

echo ">> OpenSSH sovereignty task completed."

```

```bash
#!/bin/bash

# Task: Sovereignize Aerc

# 1. ANALYZE: Check 'anvil.build.sh' to identify the source repository URL.
# 2. CLONE: If the source code is not present in the folder, execute the clone/download commands from 'anvil.build.sh' (only the download part, do not build yet).
# 3. DISCONNECT: Find the git repository within the folder (e.g., cd into the cloned subdir). If it is a git repo, run 'git remote remove origin' to disconnect it.
# 4. REPORT: Output the status of the repository and verify it has no remote 'origin'.

set -euo pipefail

TARGET_DIR="oss_sovereignty/sys_08_Aerc"
BUILD_SH="anvil.build.sh"

# Function to check if a directory is a git repository
is_git_repo() {
  [ -d "$1/.git" ]
}

# 1. Analyze anvil.build.sh
AERC_URL=$(grep -oE 'git clone https:\/\/git.sr.ht\/~sircmpnt\/aerc' "$BUILD_SH" | awk '{print $3}')
AERC_DIR="$TARGET_DIR/aerc"

echo "Aerc URL: $AERC_URL"
echo "Aerc Directory: $AERC_DIR"

# 2. Clone/Download if not present
if [ ! -d "$AERC_DIR" ]; then
  echo "Aerc source not found. Cloning..."
  mkdir -p "$TARGET_DIR"
  git clone "$AERC_URL" "$AERC_DIR"
else
  echo "Aerc source found."
fi

# 3. Disconnect from origin
if is_git_repo "$AERC_DIR"; then
  echo "Aerc directory is a git repo. Disconnecting from origin..."
  pushd "$AERC_DIR" > /dev/null
  git remote remove origin
  popd > /dev/null
else
  echo "Aerc directory is NOT a git repo."
fi

# 4. Report
echo "Reporting status:"
if is_git_repo "$AERC_DIR"; then
  pushd "$AERC_DIR" > /dev/null
  REMOTE=$(git remote get-url origin 2>/dev/null)
  popd > /dev/null
  if [ -z "$REMOTE" ]; then
    echo "Aerc repository: Disconnected from origin."
  else
    echo "ERROR: Aerc repository still has remote origin: $REMOTE"
  fi
else
  echo "Aerc is not a git repository."
fi
```

```bash
    """
    Installs the created Gzip archive into the target directory.
    """

    # Define source and destination paths
    source_file = os.path.join(artifacts_dir, "initrd.cpio.gz")
    target_file = os.path.join(install_dir, "initrd.cpio.gz")

    # Copy the archive
    print(f">> [Gzip Install] Copying archive from {source_file} to {target_file}")
    shutil.copy2(source_file, target_file)  # copy2 preserves metadata

    print(">> [Gzip Install] Gzip archive installed successfully.")


def create_gzip_archive(source_dir, target_file):
    """
    Creates a gzipped archive from the given source directory.
    """

    import io

    with tarfile.open(fileobj=tar_buffer, mode='w:gz') as tar:
        tar.add(source_dir, arcname='.')  # Add the directory contents to the root of the archive

    with open(target_file, "wb") as f:
```
